search_information.query_displayed: Bad News concerning IQ Tests. Gordon, Robert A. Rudert, Eileen E. Sociology of Education

organic_results.title: Bad news concerning IQ tests
organic_results.snippet: This issues' paper by Guterman shows that IQ predicts important criterion variables equally well across social class in a predominantly white sample, leading to the conclusion that IQ tests are not socioeconomically biased. The present paper places Guterman's finding in the context of more general studies concerned with possible racial bias in IQ tests. These studies approach the problem of bias in two major ways, through external validity, like Guterman's, and through internal validity, which deals with the detailed behavior of test items …

publication_info.summary: RA Gordon, EE Rudert - Sociology of Education, 1979 - JSTOR
